result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius Ahmad Neylon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Julius Ahmad Neylon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Plummer appears on behalf of Attorney Andrew Joel Golden by video for Julius Ahmad Neylon.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Dantzler. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case remains calendared for a return on doctors report 11/08/2022 at 8:30am in Branch 40.

Defendant Julius Ahmad Neylon not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Julius Ahmad Neylon.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  Attorney Golden has been appointed as counsel for the defendant.  Defense filed a motion for change of plea to special plea.  Defendant to be examined by Dr. Jenna Goebel.  Order for NGI Examination, signed and filed.   Court scheduled preliminary hearing and return on doctor's report dates.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Defense's Motion for Change of Plea to Special Plea.

Defendant Julius Ahmad Neylon not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE  to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Julius Ahmad Neylon not in court, in custody. Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for State of Wisconsin in court. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Officer Vargas.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Julius Ahmad Neylon in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Julius Ahmad Neylon in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Julius Ahmad Neylon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
